text: A man who is reproved, being stubborn of neck—
suddenly he will be broken, and there will not be healing.
When the righteous are numerous, the people will rejoice,
but when the wicked are ruling, people will groan.
A man who loves wisdom will make his parents glad,
but the friend of prostitutes\f + \fr 29:3 \ft Or “whores” \f* will squander his wealth.
By justice a king gives stability \add to\add* a land,
but a man of bribes will ruin it.
A strong man who flatters his neighbor
is spreading a net for his feet.
In transgression, an evil man \add is\add* a snare,
but \add the\add* righteous will sing and rejoice.\f + \fr 29:6 \ft Hebrew “he will rejoice” \f*
\add The\add* righteous knows \add the\add* case of the poor,
but \add the\add* wicked does not understand knowledge.
Men of scoffing set a city aflame,
but the wise turn away wrath.
\add If\add* a wise man goes to court with a foolish man,
then there is rankling and ridicule,\f + \fr 29:9 \ft Hebrew “there is ridicule” \f* but there is no relief.
Men of blood hate \add the\add* blameless,
and they seek the life of the upright.\f + \fr 29:10 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f*
A fool gives all his breath,\f + \fr 29:11 \ft Or “spirit” \f*
but \add the\add* wise holds back in quiet.
A ruler listening to a word of falsehood,
all his officials are wicked.
The poor and a man of oppression have \add this\add* in common:
Yahweh gives ⸤light to the eyes of them both⸥.\f + \fr 29:13 \ft Literally “light of the eyes of the two of them” \f*
A king who judges with truthfulness \add to\add* the poor,
his throne will be established forever.
As for a rod and reproof, they\f + \fr 29:15 \ft Hebrew “it” \f* will give wisdom,
but a neglected child is disgraced \add by\add* his mother.
With the increase of the wicked, transgression will increase,
but the righteous will look on his downfall.
Discipline your children, and they will give you rest,
and they will give delight to your soul.\f + \fr 29:17 \ft Or “life,” or “inner self” \f*
When there is no prophecy, the people cast off restraint,
but as for he who guards instruction, happiness \add is\add* his.
By words, a servant is not disciplined,
for he will understand, but there is no giving heed.
You see a man who is hasty in his words:
\add there is more\add* hope for a fool than him.
He who pampers his servant from childhood,
⸤arrogance will be his end⸥.\f + \fr 29:21 \ft Literally “and its/his end will be arrogance” \f*
A man of anger will stir strife,
and the owner of anger, much transgression.
The pride of a person will bring him humiliation,
and the lowly of spirit will obtain honor.
Being a partner with a thief is hating one’s life;\f + \fr 29:24 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f*
a curse he will hear, but not disclose.
The fear of a person will lay a snare,
but he who trusts in Yahweh will be secure.
Many are those who seek the ⸤favor⸥\f + \fr 29:26 \ft Literally “faces” \f* of a ruler,
but from Yahweh ⸤one obtains justice⸥.\f + \fr 29:26 \ft Literally “\fq comes \ft justice for a man” \f*
A man of injustice is an abomination to the righteous,
but the ⸤upright⸥\f + \fr 29:27 \ft Literally “upright of way” \f* is an abomination to the wicked.
